result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent L Bradford

defendant.name: Bradford, Vincent L
defendant.address: 1828 N Warren Ave. Apt. A, Milwaukee, WI 53202

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

**COURT MODIFIES BOND TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT, RATHER THAN NO CONTACT.**

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no violent contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:16 AM Defendant Vincent L Bradford in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim A appears by zoom at the request of the court.
State has complied with victim's rights.
Case called to request modification of bond filed 6/13/22.
Defense makes arguments on the record to modify the bond to no violent contact, rather than no contact with the victim.
Court modifies the signature bond to No violent contact, rather than no contact with the victim.
Defendant to sign bond.
Defense has received discovery. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date with time to complete treatment. 
Court removes 7/11/22 hearing.
Victim may appear in person or by zoom. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Motion to Modify Bond filed by Atty Griffis   **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 6/14/22 - Set for BBH next week; the State to notify Victim A of the hearing and the need to be present either in person or by zoom.*

08:44 AM Defendant Vincent L Bradford in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status. 
Defense just received an offer prior to this hearing that the Defendant would like to accept. 
Defense requests time to complete conditions required to accept offer. 
  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:42 AM Defendant Vincent L Bradford in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status.
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
Defense expects the case to resolve, but requests more time to negotiate with the State.
  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 01:49 PM Defendant Vincent L Bradford in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
